verses.roman:
atha ha bhagavaṁs tava caraṇa-nalina-yugalaṁ
tri-bhuvana-gurubhir abhivanditam
aham ayāta-yāma-yajuṣ-kāma upasarāmīti

synonyms: atha—thus; ha—indeed; bhagavan—O lord; tava—your; caraṇa-nalina-yugalam—two lotus feet; tri-bhuvana—of the three worlds; gurubhiḥ—by the spiritual masters; abhivanditam—honored; aham—I; ayāta-yāma—unknown to anyone else; yajuḥ-kāmaḥ—desiring to have the yajur-mantras; upasarāmi—am approaching with worship; iti—thus.
translation: Therefore, my lord, I am prayerfully approaching your lotus feet, which are honored by the spiritual masters of the three worlds, because I hope to receive from you mantras of the Yajur Veda unknown to anyone else.
